item.title: Destiny 2 Weekly Reset: New Nightfall, Challenges, and Rewards
item.description:
Updated July 8, 2025: Another week has come for Destiny 2 , which means missions, challenges, and rewards have been reset. More revelations have come out surrounding The Edge of Fate, this time with Bungie dropping a big blog post following a livestream event. Weapons are getting a balancing pass and, specifically, Bungie highlighted a number of Destiny 2 exotics that are getting buffed in the upcoming expansion.

In addition, Bungie also outlined major changes coming to the Tower vendors. Specifically, the vendor reputation system in Destiny 2 is getting removed entirely, and certain inventories are getting shuffled around a bit. Xur is also seeing changes, no longer offering legendary armor pieces and expanding his weapon offerings, featuring 2 options for each class per weekend and adding legendary guns from the Brave Arsenal, Legacy Nightfall, and Trials of Osiris pools.

In the meantime though, the Destiny 2 weekly reset has returned, bringing with it the usual refreshed content, activities, and rewards for players to chase over the next week. For a complete look at all the new content available for the week of July 8, including Nightfalls, Crucible modes, and challenges, here is everything players need to know.

Weekly Nightfall and Modifiers

Nightfall Strike : Heist Battleground: Mars

Advanced Modifiers:

  • Champions : Unstoppable and Barrier
  • Hero Modifiers: Extra Shields. Arc, Solar, and Void.
  • Galvanized : Combatants have more health and are more difficult to stun.
  • Overcharge : Machine Gun and Kinetic weapons when the player's subclass matches an active Surge element.
  • Threat : Solar
  • Surge : Void
  • Fire Pit : When defeated, Acolytes spawn fire pools that cause damage over time.

Expert Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Equipment Locked : Unable to change equipment once the mission starts.
  • Randomized Banes : Combatants are granted random Banes.
  • Expert Modifiers : Extra Shields

Master Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Master Modifiers : Locked Loadout, Extra Champions, and Extra Shields.
  • Togetherness : Base health regen is reduced. If near another player, health regen is increased.

Grandmaster Modifiers:

  • All previous modifiers.
  • Grandmaster Modifiers : Extinguish, Limited Revives, Contest, Join In Progress Disabled, Extra Champions, Locked Loadout, Extra Shields.
  • Chaff : Radar is disabled.

_______________________________________________________________

  • Nightfall Weapon : Wild Style (Legendary Grenade Launcher)

Episode: Heresy Challenges

  • All Challenges Are Now Available

Exotic Mission Rotation

Bungie brought back various exotic missions for players to run through to earn new rewards, gear, as well as craftable versions of exotic weapons. Like the Raid and Dungeon rotator, this one changes on a weekly basis.

Featured Exotic Mission : node.ovrd.AVALON (Vexcalibur Exotic Glaive)

Raid and Dungeon Rotation

Originally introduced during Season 17, Bungie features Raids and Dungeons in a weekly rotation to make them farmable with updated rewards. Bungie is making 2 of each available in the featured rotation each week:

  • Featured Raid : Deep Stone Crypt and Root of Nightmares
  • Featured Dungeon : Duality and The Shattered Throne

Raid Challenges

  • Salvation's Edge : Coordinated Efforts
  • Deep Stone Crypt : Copies of Copies, Red Rover, Of All Trades, The Core Four
  • Vow of the Disciple : Swift Destruction
  • Vault of Glass : Out of Its Way
  • King's Fall : Devious Thievery
  • Root of Nightmares : Cosmic Equilibrium, Illuminated Torment, Crossfire, All Hands
  • Garden of Salvation : Leftovers
  • Last Wish : Which Witch

Ritual Activities: Crucible and Gambit

Players can earn additional rewards through Destiny 2 's Pathfinder system simply by playing and performing certain tasks in ritual activities like Vanguard Strikes, Crucible, and Gambit.

Legacy Activities and Challenges

Europa

  • Exo Challenge : Simulation: Safeguard
  • Eclipsed Zone : Cadmus Ridge
  • Empire Hunt : Praksis, The Technocrat

Neomuna

  • Incursion Zone : Liming Harbor
  • Campaign Mission : No Time Left
  • Partition: Hard Reset

Throne World

  • Weekly Story Mission : The Communion
  • Altars of Reflection : Weekly activity that players can take on through specifically marked icons within the Throne World. These missions typically involve light puzzle solving as well as battling enemy combatants.

The Moon

  • Trove Guardian : Hellmouth
  • Wandering Nightmare : Nightmare of Horkis, Fear of Mithrax (Anchor of Light)
  • Campaign : In The Deep

Nightmare Rotation:

  • Fanatic (Insanity)
  • Skolas (Pride)
  • Omnigul (Anguish)

Dreaming City

  • The Dreaming City Curse Level : High - The Dark Monastery
  • Petra Venj Location : Rheasilvia
  • The Blind Well : Taken enemies - Plague: Inomina
  • Ascendant Challenge : Keep of Honed Edges (Harbinger's Seclude)

Dares of Eternity Rotation

  • Round 1 : Hive
  • Round 2 : Vex
  • Final Round : Valus Ta'aurc

Xur Details

Xur, the exotic merchant of Destiny 2 , arrives every weekend until reset, giving players a short window to check out what he has in stock. With The Final Shape, Xur has seen a rework of what is on offer. Here's what the merchant has for the weekend of 7/4:

  • Phoenix Protocol (Warlock chest armor)
  • Raiden Flux (Hunter chest armor)
  • Khepri's Horn (Titan helmet)
  • Arbalest (Linear Fusion Rifle)
  • Hard Light (Auto Rifle)
  • The Queenbreaker (Heavy Linear Fusion Rifle)
  • Hawkmoon (Hand Cannon)
  • Choir of One (Auto Rifle) - Recommended!
  • Jotunn Catalyst
  • Leviathan's Breath Catalyst
  • The Xurfboard (Skimmer Board Vehicle)
  • Essentialism/Stoicism/Solipsism OR Exotic Cipher
  • Exotic Engram
  • Enhancement Prism
  • Glimmer
  • Enhancement Core
  • Legendary Engram
  • Strange Gift (Random Item for 1 Strange Coin)
  • Blood Feud (Kinetic Submachine Gun)
  • A Distant Pull (Kinetic Sniper Rifle)
  • Brigand's Law (Energy Sidearm)
  • Brya's Love (Energy Scout Rifle)
  • Planck's Stride (Heavy Machine Gun)
  • Code Duello (Heavy Rocket Launcher)
  • Crown-Splitter/Quickfang/Eternity's Edge (Heavy Sword)
  • Strange Weapon Engram
  • Veiled Tithes Armor Set

Make sure to check back every Friday for a comprehensive breakdown of all the new exotic gear and rolls that Xur brings to Destiny 2 .

Trials of Osiris Map and Weekly Adept Weapon

Saint-14 and the Trails of Osiris offer players a high-end PvP activity in exchange for powerful rewards. Starting with Episode Heresy, Bungie made getting to the Lighthouse easier, while still offering top-tier rewards for those who can achieve a winning streak. Similar to most vendors in Destiny 2 , Saint-14 has a reputation system that rewards players for ranking up through playing and completing bounties.

Trials of Osiris for 7/4:

  • Map : Dissonance, Eventide Labs, Cirrus Plaza
  • Weapon : The Inquisitor (Adept Shotgun), Shayura's Wrath (Adept Submachine Gun)

item.title: Xbox Game Pass Sci-Fi Horror Game Suddenly Reappears After Being Missing for 3 Years
item.description:
First-person sci-fi horror game Routine is still being worked on and is "beginning to approach the finish line," according to developer Lunar Software. Routine was first revealed all the way back in 2012 and initially had a 2013 release window, though after hitting a number of development roadblocks, Lunar Software decided to shelve the game indefinitely, only to pick development back up again a decade later, in 2022, with the support of indie publisher Raw Fury.

Summer Game Fest 2022 was the site of Routine 's surprise reappearance. Its 90-second gameplay trailer impressed sci-fi horror fans with its 1970s-style environments, 80s-inspired tech, and dark, moody atmosphere. The game's scanline-infused aesthetic stood out against the crowd of other big sci-fi horror games being shown off at the time, some at that very same showcase, and it was at the end of this new trailer that Routine confirmed its day one Xbox Game Pass launch.

Despite a promising reappearance, it's now been three years since, with nothing but radio silence from Lunar Software on Routine, until now. Lunar Software made a short post on Steam giving fans a brief update on the state of the game. Titled "Heartbeat," the post mentions that the development of Routine is going smoothly, and the three-person team is now excitedly approaching the home stretch. Lunar also broke the bad news that acclaimed composer Mick Gordon, known mainly for the explosive Doom (2016) and Doom Eternal soundtracks, parted ways with Routine a year ago, though the team has been permitted to use his work in the final game.

Lunar Software Gives Promising Update on Routine

While some have undoubtedly been displeased with Routine 's three years of radio silence, the game was able to get away from the 2022 and 2023 sci-fi horror hotspot, where games like The Callisto Protocol , EA's Dead Space remake, Fort Solis , and others dominated the horror spotlight. With those massive titles out of the way, Routine will surely be able to have an easier time standing out when it releases than back around its 2022 re-reveal. Lunar Software's Steam post didn't give Routine any sort of new release window, but if the studio truly is approaching the finish line as it says, it wouldn't be surprising to see it release sometime in 2026, though this is pure speculation.

With Gamescom Opening Night Live right around the corner and The Game Awards set for the end of the year as usual, there's a chance Routine could appear with a new trailer on either of these stages. It was at a Geoff Keighley event that the game made its reappearance, so Routine popping up at another Keighley show would make sense. The bigger question would be whether the potential new trailer ends with a release date. Perhaps a PlayStation version may also be confirmed, since as of now, Routine is coming only to Xbox and PC.

item.title: Ironically, The Most Frustrating Starfield Quest is the Perfect Inspiration for New Content
item.description:
Starfield has been in something of a holding pattern ever since its last significant piece of content, the Shattered Space DLC, released to lukewarm reception last September. Since then, developer Bethesda has not offered up much regarding its plans for Starfield , despite its prior statements that it is committed to continuing support, leaving fans in freefall and wondering where it might go from there.

Adding to this radio silence, Starfield was completely absent from the Xbox Games Showcase during this year's Summer Game Fest, with no news or updates about what will be coming next to the open-world sci-fi RPG. Starfield 's reputation thus remains uneven, and there's one quest that seems to capture this sensation: First Contact. The mission has an excellent narrative setup and fits well into the world, but is a bit of a letdown in terms of execution and offering fans more interesting and robust choices. There is good potential in First Contact, though, which could help inform how Starfield can correct course down the line.

Bethesda's parent company, ZeniMax Media, previously filed for the "Starborn" trademark, which some have taken to indicate the potential direction of future Starfield content, but nothing official has been announced as yet.

The Untapped Potential of Starfield's First Contact Quest Could Be Fertile Ground for Future Content

Starfield's First Contact Quest is More Than a Little Underwhelming

Starfield 's First Contact quest sees players receiving an urgent call from Jiro Sugiyama, the chief of security for the luxury hotel Paradiso on the planet Porrima 2, located in the system of the same name. Investigating further, fans can dock with a ship in Porrima's orbit, The ECS Constant. Captain Brackenridge then explains that The Constant has been traveling for nearly 200 years, having left Old Earth centuries ago expecting to make Porrima their new home.

The issue is that Paradiso CEO, Oliver Campbell, has full legal rights to the planet and resort, and the colonists' presence presents a pickle. Players can then attempt a resolution and decide on one of three options:

  • Procure and install a new gravity drive for The Constant
  • Broker a deal that sees the crew become indentured servants on Paradiso
  • Sabotage and destroy The Constant

The main issue with the quest is that these are rather limiting, and there's no way to let the colonists fully complete their original mission. The second path can be considered closest, but is still less than desirable and quite morally dubious. Even the generally agreed-upon good outcome of purchasing the grav-drive isn't as satisfying as it might've been, and the overall sentiment is that First Contact could've used a second look.

How Starfield Could Expand and Improve On its First Contact Quest

Bethesda often highlights its focus on player freedom and choice, and while First Contact's story framework works great for the setting, it lacks in the latter areas. There is a lot more to be mined from it, both within its self-contained narrative and ideas that could be broadly applied in Starfield to grant players more and better agency across its quests and their possible outcomes.

It's been noted that First Contact strongly resembles Tenpenny Tower in Fallout 3 , with the residents of a safe and luxurious place at odds with a group of outsiders, with the two asking the player character to find or mediate a solution. Using First Contact as a jumping-off point, Starfield could explore this concept in more depth. Bethesda could introduce other similar generation ships, along with perhaps meaningful and interesting updates on Paradiso or The Constant's status or depending on what fans decided.

If there are more ships like The Constant roaming Starfield 's galaxy, players could then happen upon or be directed to them, and find themselves in various situations. These might be things like clearing a spot on a planet full of hostile creatures or factions to secure a new home. This could also tie in well with base building, as fans might then be tasked with constructing a habitat or other outcomes that entail further requests and more unique missions. Hopefully, Bethesda considers some of Starfield 's missteps and finds some enjoyable and creative ways of improving this aspect.

item.title: Palworld Ground Mount Tier List
item.description:
Palworld 's vast open world demands efficient transportation, and ground mounts serve as essential companions for traversing the diverse landscapes of Palpagos Island. While Palworld 's flying mounts might seem superior due to their perceived ability to cover ground much quicker, ground mounts also offer unique advantages, including cave accessibility, stamina efficiency, and specialized abilities that make them indispensable for serious players. Based on community feedback, speed testing, and practical utility, here's how every major ground mount ranks.

S-Tier: Speedsters and Elite Performers

  • Necromus
  • Dazemu
  • Paladius

Necromus

Necromus stands as the undisputed champion of ground mounts in Palworld , boasting an incredible sprint speed of 1600 that leaves all competitors in the dust. This legendary Dark-type Pal represents the pinnacle of land-based transportation, offering not just raw speed but also practical utility through its double jump ability.

However, reaching Necromus requires defeating it alongside Paladius in a challenging endgame boss battle, making it accessible only to the most dedicated players.

The creature's legendary status comes with appropriate rewards Necromus can maintain its breakneck pace across virtually any terrain while providing enough maneuverability to navigate complex environments. When properly bred with speed-enhancing passive skills in Palworld , like Swift and Runner, Necromus becomes an unstoppable force that makes exploration feel effortless.

Dazemu

Dazemu is arguably the fastest ground mount in the game due to its unique terrain-based speed bonus. What makes Dazemu particularly valuable is that the game's definition of "sand" is remarkably generous, as most dirt paths and desert areas count as sandy terrain, providing consistent speed boosts throughout exploration.

Unlike the endgame legendary mounts, Dazemu becomes available at level 22, making it an accessible powerhouse for mid-game players. Its frequent spawns in the Anubis Desert allow players to capture multiple specimens for condensing, potentially reaching four-star status within an hour of focused hunting.

Paladius

Paladius rounds out the S-tier with a remarkable triple jump ability that more than compensates for being slightly slower than Necromus. While its sprint speed of 1400 falls short of its legendary counterpart, Paladius excels in vertical mobility and terrain navigation. The triple jump proves invaluable for climbing cliffs, accessing elevated areas, and maintaining momentum across challenging landscapes. As a legendary Pal encountered alongside Necromus, Paladius shares the same accessibility challenges but offers a slightly different playstyle focused on agility over raw speed.

A-Tier: Reliable Workhorses

  • Pyrin and Pyrin Noct
  • Direhowl
  • Rayhound

Pyrin and Pyrin Noct

The Pyrin variants represent excellent mid-game mount options that bridge the gap between early accessibility and endgame performance. With a respectable sprint speed of 1300, these Fire and Dark-type mounts provide consistent performance while adding elemental damage to the player's attacks when mounted. Pyrin becomes available at level 30, making it one of the first rapid mounts players can access.

Pyrin Noct offers the same statistical performance -- albeit with Dark-type damage application, providing players with elemental variety based on their combat needs. Both variants benefit significantly from passive skill breeding, with proper combinations pushing their effective speed well beyond their base statistics.

Direhowl

Despite its relatively modest sprint speed, Direhowl earns its prestige through exceptional early-game value and surprising longevity. Available at level 9, Direhowl often serves as players' first proper mount and can remain viable throughout the entire game when properly upgraded. Its compact size allows access to dungeons and caves where larger mounts struggle.

Rayhound

Rayhound is an Electric-type mount that combines decent speed with valuable mobility options. Its double-jump ability provides more maneuverability than single-jump mounts while maintaining competitive speed. The combination of electrical attacks and enhanced mobility makes Rayhound particularly effective against Water-type enemies. Available at level 26, Rayhound serves as an excellent stepping stone between early-game mounts and legendary options.

B-Tier: Solid Choices with Specific Advantages

Fenglope

Fenglope presents an interesting case study in mount design, offering a modest base speed but possessing one of the most powerful special abilities in the game. The Cloud Tempest Palworld skill provides explosive forward momentum that can surpass even S-tier mounts in short bursts, making it excellent for specific traversal situations.

However, Fenglope's signature ability becomes less effective in confined spaces like dungeons, which limits its overall utility.

Univolt

Univolt serves as an excellent early-game mount that stays relevant throughout the mid-game progression. Its Electric-type attacks prove particularly effective against Water-type enemies, while its reasonable speed and early availability make it a popular choice for players upgrading from Direhowl. While eventually outclassed by higher-tier options, Univolt's combination of accessibility, utility, and upgrade potential makes it a trusty performer that most players will appreciate during their journey.

Blazamut and Blazamut Ryu

While not the fastest mounts available, the Blazamut variants provide substantial damage bonuses and can serve dual roles as both transportation and combat partners. Blazamut Ryu, in particular, offers enhanced stats that justify its inclusion despite its moderate speed.

C-Tier: Functional Options

  • Arsox
  • Eithyrdeer Variants

Arsox represents the classic mid-tier mount experiencefunctional but mundane. Its double jump provides some utility advantage, and the tree-cutting efficiency offers practical value for resource-gathering expeditions. However, its speed falls short of higher-tier options. The Fire-type damage application provides some combat utility, but not enough to compensate for the speed disadvantage in most practical situations.

Palworld 's Eikthyrdeer variants, on the other hand, serve as reliable early-to-mid-game mounts that perform adequately without excelling in any particular area. They're accessible stepping stones, but their modest speed cements their temporary status.

D-Tier: Slow but Serviceable

  • Melpaca
  • Rushoar
  • Mammorest Variants

Melpaca

Melpaca is primarily an early-game mount that helps players transition away from walking everywhere. Found in incredible numbers throughout the Palpagos Islands' central region, Melpaca offers easy access and basic mounting functionality, but its low speed makes it feel cumbersome once players experience faster alternatives.

Rushoar

Rushoar, many players' first mount experience, is unlocked at level 6 with useful rock-breaking capabilities. While its charging attack proves valuable for mining operations, its speed limitations become apparent quickly as players progress, and its role often shifts to specialized mining assistance as faster mounts become available.

Mammorest and Mammorest Cryst

The Mammorest variants represent the extreme end of the size-versus-speed trade-off. While their massive size and impressive appearance might attract new players, their sluggish movement speed makes them impractical for serious transportation needs. They function better as mobile bases or combat tanks than efficient mounts, making them novelty options rather than practical choices for traversal.

DIGITAL

In this game, you can peacefully live alongside mysterious creatures known as Pals or risk your life to drive off a ruthless poaching syndicate. Pals can be used to fight and breed, or they can be made to work on farms or factories. You can even sell them or eat them.
Survival: In a harsh environment where food is scarce and vicious poachers roam, danger waits around every corner. To survive, you must tread carefully and make difficult choices...even if that means eating your own Pals when the time comes.
Mounts & Exploration: Pals can be mounted to traverse the land, sea and skyallowing you to traverse all kinds of environment as you explore the world.
Collect all kinds of exciting Pals to fight, farm, build, and work for you in this completely new multiplayer, open world survival and crafting game!

item.title: Overwatch 2 May Not Be Able to Beat Marvel Rivals in One Race, But It Can Lap it in Another
item.description:
For almost a decade, Overwatch had a monopoly on the hero shooter genre. It may not have created the genre, but Overwatch did popularize it for a new generation of players, with its distinct blend of high-budget presentation, rewarding team-oriented gameplay, and colorful cast of characters keeping it in the public consciousness. There have been plenty of competitors who have come for the throne over the years, but few have managed to put up a real fight. That is, until Marvel Rivals .

Making its debut last December, Marvel Rivals was an overnight smash success, capitalizing on its use of IP expertly. Though its player-count has been steadily declining over the last eight months, Marvel Rivals is still pulling in around 100,000 players a day on Steam alone, which is higher than Overwatch 2 's all-time peak player-count (75,608) on the same platform, according to SteamDB. The competition between these hero shooters is still fierce however, and while Overwatch will never be able to outdo Marvel Rivals in one area, it could beat it to the punch in another.

Overwatch 2 Might Be Able to Beat Marvel Rivals to The Punch In One Way

Overwatch 2 Can't Compete With Marvel Rivals' Hero Output

Since its launch last December, Marvel Rivals has added six new playable heroes, with four arriving in its first season, and another two hitting the hero shooter in its second. From here on out, Marvel Rivals will be bringing one new hero to the game every month. Marvel Rivals Season 3, for instance, is releasing in just a few days' time, and it'll add Jean Grey/Phoenix to the roster off the bat and Blade during the mid-season refresh.

By the end of Season 3, Marvel Rivals will have 41 playable heroes. That means by August 2025, Marvel Rivals will have just two fewer heroes than Overwatch 2 , something it'll have achieved in a fraction of the time. Though Overwatch 2 is still receiving new heroes consistently, it's at a much slower rate, with one new hero being added every four months or so.

It seems very unlikely that Overwatch 2 will pivot to releasing heroes at a faster rate, so at least for now, it's one large area where Marvel Rivals has the clear advantage.

Overwatch 2 Could Offer Something Marvel Rivals Is Only Thinking About

In a recent VideoGamer interview with Marvel Rivals director Guangyun Chen, the idea of fans voting on new playable heroes was floated. The director said the development team already takes current unofficial fan votes into account when determining who should appear next in Marvel Rivals , and that there's a possibility an official fan vote could arrive in the future.

Blizzard could beat NetEase to the punch here. While Overwatch 2 's next hero, Wuyang, has already been confirmed, Blizzard could give fans the option to vote on the hero after them. Fans could be presented with three potential concepts a few seasons in advance, giving the developers plenty of time to create the hero. This could go a long way in bolstering Overwatch 2 's sense of community, and keep the current player-base invested for at least a few months while they wait to see their chosen hero come to life.

Overwatch 2 isn't going to beat Marvel Rivals when it comes to hero output, but it could start to make its hero drops matter just a little bit more.
